resource.chars:
REFEREE'S REPORT
To the Sectional Committee for Mathematics
Paper by D.R. Bates, A. Fundaminsky & H.S.W. Massey, F.R.S. 
On Excitation and ionization of atoms by electron 
impact. I. The Born and Oppenheimer approxi-
mations - General theory
1. Is the paper suitable for reading before a meeting of the Society? 
Yes
2. Does it contain contributions to knowledge of sufficient scientific interest for the space 
required? 
Yes
3. Are any portions of the paper, or any illustrations, redundant? 
No
4. Should the paper by published by the Society? 
Yes
5. If so, in the 'Philosophical Transactions' or the 'Proceedings'? (see note on opposite 
page). Transactions 
6. Or could it more appropriately be published by some other body? 
No
7. Comments or criticisms which might enable the author to improve or correct his statement. 
(Further remarks may be attached.) 
I would recommend that this paper and the following one be combined in a single 
paper, because they are clearly connected and anyone who reads one will want to read the 
other. They could be very well published in the transactions, because the work is of a 
kind that will not quickly get out of date and will be referred to for a long time to 
come. 
It would need only small changes to combine the two papers. It would be necessary 
to state separately the authors for Part I and Part II and to change the references to the first part in 
the second, and to combine the two lists of references. I would recommend that the two abstracts 
be combined into one and the two introductions be left separate. 
Signature P A M Dirac
